Enumerations

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the data structures which are exposed to the application.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct DPM_Buffer_t DPM_Buffer

DPM Buffer Interface.

The DPM processing chain receive data buffers which are to be processed. The DPC processes these buffers and generates the results which are then passed to the application. The structure encompasses this information.

typedef enum DPM_Domain_e DPM_Domain

DPM Data Path Domain.

The enumeration is used to describe the domains to which the data path processing chains extend.

typedef struct DPM_DPCAssert_t DPM_DPCAssert

Processing Chain Assert.

Processing chains while executing on a core can encounter a fatal error. In such a scenario the DPM entities would need to be notified with information relevant to the error. The assertion information block here can be exchanged

typedef struct DPM_DPCInfo_t DPM_DPCInfo

Data Path Processing Chain Information.

Processing Chain specific information which can be passed by DPC developers to the application. The DPM Module does not define this information but is DPC specific. Please refer to the DPC documentation on how this information is interpreted.

typedef struct DPM_InitCfg_t DPM_InitCfg

Initialization configuration.

The structure is used to initialize the DPM module

typedef struct DPM_ProcChainCfg_t DPM_ProcChainCfg

Processing Chain Configuration.

The DPM module is responsible for the registeration and execution of processing chains. Processing Chains can be created and registered by populating the following configuration

typedef enum DPM_Report_e DPM_Report

Report Types.

The enumeration is used to describe the various reports which are generated by the Module. Applications are notified about the operational status of the Module through these reports via the registered Reporting Function. Applications are expected to interpret these reports and take appropriate action.

typedef void(* DPM_ReportFxn) (DPM_Report reportType, uint32_t instanceId, int32_t errCode, uint32_t arg0, uint32_t arg1)

Description
Applications can register a report function which is invoked by the module to report the status of the processing chain to the application. The mechanism can be used to inform the applications about the status of the processing chain.

Parameters
[in]reportTypeReport Type
[in]instanceIdDPM Instance Identifier which generated the response.
[in]errCodeError code associated with the status event. This will be set to 0 to indicate that the report was successful.
[in]arg0Optional argument.
[in]arg1Optional argument.

NOTE: Please refer to the DPM_Report for more information about the optional arguments and how to interpret them.

Return values
Notapplicable

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum DPM_Domain_e

DPM Data Path Domain.

The enumeration is used to describe the domains to which the data path processing chains extend.

Enumerator
DPM_Domain_LOCALIZED 

Localized Domain: The Control & Data Path chain is executed in the context of single subsystem i.e. MSS or DSS only.

DPM_Domain_REMOTE 

Remote Domain: The DPM Data Path Processing chain is executed in the context of single subsystem i.e. MSS or DSS only. However the DPM control can be executed from another subsystem.

For example: On the XWR16xx the MSS could be controlling the DPM while the data processing chain is entirely executing on the DSS

DPM_Domain_DISTRIBUTED 

Distributed Domain: The DPM Data Path Processing chain is executed in the context of multiple subsystems. The DPM control can be executed from either subsystem.

enum DPM_Report_e

Report Types.

The enumeration is used to describe the various reports which are generated by the Module. Applications are notified about the operational status of the Module through these reports via the registered Reporting Function. Applications are expected to interpret these reports and take appropriate action.

Enumerator
DPM_Report_DPC_STARTED 

This is the report type to indicate that the processing chain has been started.

Argument Value Description
arg0 0 Not Used
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued to all DPM entities

Once the processing chain has been successfully started the application can start the BSS via the MMWave API

DPM_start

DPM_Report_DPC_STOPPED 

This is the report type to indicate that the processing chain has been stopped.

Argument Value Description
arg0 0 Not Used
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued to all DPM entities

DPM_stop

DPM_Report_DPC_ASSERT 

This is the report type to indicate that the processing chain executing has detected a fault/exception.

Argument Value Description
arg0 &DPM_DPCAssert Address of the assert information
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued to all DPM entities

DPM_DPCAssert

DPM_Report_IOCTL 

This is the report type to indicate that the processing chain is being configured via the DPM_ioctl interface. The following is the interpretation of the optional arguments:-.

Argument Value Description
arg0 Command Standard/DPC specific commands
arg1 Command Specific Data Refer to the command documentation

This report is issued to all DPM entities

DPM_ioctl

DPM_Report_NOTIFY_DPC_RESULT 

This is the report type to indicate that the processing chain has results which are available.

Argument Value Description
arg0 &DPM_Buffer Address of the DPM Result
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued only to the remote DPM entity on which the DPC is not executing.

DPM_Buffer

DPM_Report_NOTIFY_DPC_RESULT_ACKED 

This is the report type to indicate that the remote DPM domain has acknowledged the DPC results.

Argument Value Description
arg0 &DPM_Buffer Address of the DPM Result
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued only to the DPM entity on which the DPC is executing.

This is an acknowledgment that the results have been passed to the remote DPM domain. This report is only generated if the "isAckNeeded" flag is set.

DPM_Buffer

DPM_Report_DPC_INFO 

This is the report type to indicate that the DPC has passed information to the application. Application developers would need to read the processing chain specific documentation to interpret this information.

Argument Value Description
arg0 &DPM_DPCInfo DPC Specific information
arg1 0 Not Used

This report is issued to all DPM entities.

DPM_DPCInfo
